page.title: 12CHILD'S VIEW 1-S OF BARRHEAD
page.content:
We are very fortunate to live in an area like{Barrhead}which is on the out-skirts of{Glasgow.}We have many facilities close at hand but just as important we have the countryside on our doorstep. One of the most attractive spots in our countryside is the{'Craigie'}hill with the {Glanderston Dam}at its foot.
The history of the Craigie goes back to{Iron Age}times when there was a settlement there called{Duncarnock. Through the years its name has changed to the{Craigie}which, because of lack of information in books, we can only presume comes from the word{CRAG, meaning{'hilly rock'.
continued on page 13
